definition: variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: The uncle, known the truth, as older people, he can let?
sentences.chinese: 对于姨夫，晓之于理，那样岁数的人了，他还能咱样？

sentences.english: The majority of the squad are aging and putting the pensioners into Chelsea.
sentences.chinese: 他们的球员大都上了岁数，在切尔西挣着养老金。

sentences.english: And Sarah was an hundred and seven and twenty years old: these were the years of the life of Sarah.
sentences.chinese: 撒拉享寿一百二十七岁，这是撒拉一生的岁数。

sentences.english: One old man died on board, " says Hassan."
sentences.chinese: 结果一位上岁数的人死在了船上。
脱衣舞女的岁数都大了。

sentences.english: Her 20-year-old sister is the second youngest on the list.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大20岁的姐姐是岁数第二小的上榜富豪。

sentences.english: These ancient trees are quite old.
sentences.chinese: 这些古树的岁数可都不小了。

sentences.english: Older people prefer new notes; younger ones are not so fussy.
sentences.chinese: 上了岁数的人喜欢新钞，年轻人对新旧并不太在意。

sentences.english: Usually, a patient of that age will be escorted by a younger.
sentences.chinese: 通常这岁数的病人，都会由年轻一代的陪同。

sentences.english: She wasn't quite old enough for classic dementia.
sentences.chinese: 她还没老到得典型性痴呆的岁数。

sentences.english: He is getting old and he often think of the time when he was young.
sentences.chinese: 他上岁数了，他经常想起年轻时的岁月。

sentences.english: You should n't sell cigarettes to teenagers who are under age to under-age teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该把香烟卖给没到岁数的青少年。

sentences.english: You'd better not to muck about any more. You're old enough to get a job.
sentences.chinese: 你别再混日子啦，像你这岁数早该找个活儿干了。

sentences.english: When the value of Zebu, and you are so big that a small Ga age of the jumping beans, he said.
sentences.chinese: 咋不值当的，你这么大的岁数该他这小嘎蹦豆说的。

sentences.english: By seniority, first place goes to Lao Pan.
sentences.chinese: 按岁数排，该老潘排第一。

sentences.english: You can build muscle at any age.
sentences.chinese: 无论多大岁数，你都可以锻炼肌肉。

definition: how old are you? (familiar, or to a child)
to be in the prime of life
polite term for old woman or man
variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
to admit to one's advancing years/to acquiesce to old age

one's age, according to the traditional Chinese method of reckoning (i.e. the number of Chinese calendar years in which one has lived). In this system, a person's age is one year at birth, and increases by one year at the beginning of the first solar term 立春[Li4 chun1] each year, rather than on one's birthday./as opposed to 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]
to get married and start a career (idiom)/to settle down/to establish oneself
